title: Banana Crumb Muffins Recipe
description: The best banana muffin recipes have a sweet crumb topping which is what makes these banana muffins stand apart from the ordinary. They're scrumptious!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Bread Quick Bread Recipes Muffin Recipes Banana Muffin Recipes Banana Crumb Muffins 4.8 (14,709) 10,769 Reviews 2,410 Photos The best banana muffin recipes have a sweet crumb topping which is what makes these banana muffins stand apart from the ordinary. They're scrumptious! By Lisa Kreft Updated on June 6, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 2,410 2,410 2,410 2,410 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 35 mins Servings: 10 Yield: 10 muffins Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 10 servings Muffins: 1 ¬Ω cups all-purpose flour 1 teaspoon baking soda 1 teaspoon baking powder ¬Ω teaspoon salt 3 bananas, mashed ¬æ cup white sugar ‚Öì cup butter, melted 1 egg, lightly beaten Crumb Topping: ‚Öì cup packed brown sugar 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour ‚Öõ teaspoon ground cinnamon 1 tablespoon butter Directions Gather all ingredients. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease or line 10 muffin cups with paper liners. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Prepare muffins: Mix flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt together in a large bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Beat bananas, white sugar, melted butter, and egg together in a separate bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir the banana mixture into the flour mixture just until combined. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups, filling each about 3/4 full. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Prepare crumb topping: Mix brown sugar, flour, and cinnamon together in a small bowl. Use a fork to mix in 1 tablespoon butter until mixture is crumbly; sprinkle topping over muffins. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 18 to 20 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 18,736 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 263 Calories 8g Fat 46g Carbs 3g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 10 Calories 263 % Daily Value * Total Fat 8g 10% Saturated Fat 5g 24% Cholesterol 38mg 13% Sodium 353mg 15% Total Carbohydrate 46g 17% Dietary Fiber 2g 5% Total Sugars 27g Protein 3g 6% Vitamin C 3mg 3% Calcium 43mg 3% Iron 1mg 7% Potassium 168mg 4% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Banana Crumb Muffins 01 of 2,410 Photo by¬† Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 2,410 Photo by¬† Darci Walsh 03/02/2025 Verry good 03 of 2,410 Photo by¬† Sierra Jordan 02/27/2025 A keeper! Easy to follow Easy to make, delicious results. I didnt have any baking soda so my rise got messed up a little bit, but they were still just as delicious. I took everyones advice regarding using 1/2c white sugar and 1/4 cup brown sugar. I like my crumble a little chunkier and more ‚Äúwet‚Äù so I used 2 tbs of butter and played with the ratio until I got a mixture that formed together but crumbled apart fairly still. Like a less wet playdoh. This recipe is a keeper though! I also opted to do a simple glaze on top with some lemon emulsion. Finally, I baked at 350 for about 24 min. Made 11 muffins! Make it yall! 04 of 2,410 Photo by¬† Tammy Goff 02/12/2025 A keeper! 05 of 2,410 Photo by¬† Gnome Woodsley 02/06/2025 A keeper! Excellent recipe to make use of overripe bananas. Never have brown sugar on hand so I mixed my own (1/3cup white sugar + 1tsp fancy molasses). Added nutmeg, cinnamon & vanilla to batter. Left the sugar crumble off as I planned on packaging some, figured it may be less messy. Baked for ~28 min; increased the time as I had used silicone baking cups and the muffins were still gooey by 18 min. Easy and delicious, will definitely bake again! 06 of 2,410 Photo by¬† SweetUdo1596 02/01/2025 Easy to follow Family favorite Added a few chocolate chips and vanilla essence to the batter 07 of 2,410 Photo by¬† SereneLemon4346 11/30/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Family favorite So delicious!! Great recipe, only added a tsp of mexican vanilla & everyone loved these muffins üòã 08 of 2,410 Photo by¬† Mick Mo 10/26/2024 Lisa, thank you so much for sharing this fabulous recipe!Followed the instructions and used Demerara sugar in the topping. Deeelish!!üôÇ 09 of 2,410 Photo by¬† SunnyBao3860 10/07/2024 A keeper! Family favorite I made this recipe last night, and it was amazing!!! I used all brown sugar because I didn‚Äôt have any white sugar. I also added some cinnamon to the dry ingredients. Next time I will add vanilla like some recommended, I just didn‚Äôt have any. This recipe made enough for me to have 12 muffins (my muffin pans are smaller than some.) When I tried to make the crumb topping, my butter was too warm which caused it to turn into more of a syrup than crumbs, but it was delicious, so I don‚Äôt mind. I will definitely be making these again. 10 of 2,410 Photo by¬† Audrey 09/08/2024 A keeper! Family favorite The family and I love these. Did follow K.Lynn‚Äôs suggestions about adding vanilla, nutmeg and cinnamon to the batter and the 1/2C sugar, 1/4C brown sugar. name: Lisa Kreft

Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Beat bananas, white sugar, melted butter, and egg together in a separate bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Stir the banana mixture into the flour mixture just until combined. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups, filling each about 3/4 full. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Prepare crumb topping: Mix brown sugar, flour, and cinnamon together in a small bowl. Use a fork to mix in 1 tablespoon butter until mixture is crumbly; sprinkle topping over muffins. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 18 to 20 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Serve and enjoy!
